alert.note: Alert for Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 3:44PM CDT until July 20 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT/745 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe, Loudon, McMinn, Meigs, Monroe, Rhea and Roane. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT /745 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 PM CDT /444 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Athens, Dayton, Sweetwater, Madisonville, Pikeville, Decatur, Spring City, Englewood, Vonore, Greenback, Tellico Plains, Niota, Philadelphia, Murray Store, Peakland, Ten Mile, Clear Water, Eagle Furnace, Grandview and Piney Falls State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
